column4: can anyone help me get around busybox so my machine will boot?
in the boot params try all_generic_ide
or in the busybox shell try to modprobe generic ide
it says FATAL: Module generic not found
you know the grub menu? the one you can enter at the *very* beginning (after bios)?
ah try generic_ide or generic-ide
same result for generic_ide and generic-ide
I must be mis-rememberating, hang on a sec
what about modprobe ide-disk what does that return
nothin except a new prompt
okay good
now i have a few lines saying I/O resource not free and ports already in use
I saw that still looking for a solution hang on
kk =)
what is the exact error message you get (or something close) that drops you into busybox shell
i dont see an error it goes right from the Ubuntu loading screen into the shell
i found it, had to load recovery, ALERT! /host/ubuntu/disks/root.disk does not exist

okay you need to reboot wubi, and then enter the grub menu and add that (e to edit the kernel it will boot) all_generic_ide to the end of the boot parameters (near quiet, splash, etc) then d then b to boot
followed your directions and it still didnt boot. now when i get into the shell and press ctrl-d i dont get any error message
what other partitions do you have and what format are they in or just the vista one
i do have vista installed also and thats ntfs
hmm that is odd
okay, got a bit further-->can you check /proc/partitions
